required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Evaluate an Implant With a Sloped Top in Patients With a Sloped Jaw Bone
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Open, Single Arm, Multi-center Study to Evaluate Maintenance of Lingual Bone in Healed Ridges With the ASTRA TECH Implant System, OsseoSpeed™ Profile Implant. A 3-year Follow-up Study

brief_summary.textblock:
The study aims to evaluate maintenance of lingual/palatinal marginal bone with the (ASTRA TECH Implant System) OsseoSpeed™ Profile implant in sites where the alveolar crest anatomy is sloped in a lingual to buccal direction.
The hypothesis is that the sloped marginal contour of the implant will help preserve the lingual/palatinal marginal bone.

primary_outcome.measure: Bone Level Changes at the Lingual Aspect From Implant Placement (Baseline) to 16 Weeks After Implant Placement
primary_outcome.description: Clinical measurements after implant installation and after 16 weeks to determine bone levels at the buccal and lingual aspects in relation to a fixed landmark on the implant (the rim (R), i.e. the interface between the micro-threaded part and the shoulder at the marginal portion of the implants.The assessments were made using a periodontal probe and distances were measured to the nearest 0.5 mm. Negative value denotes loss of bone.

intervention.description: ASTRA TECH Implant System, OsseoSpeed™ Profile implants: Ø4.5, 5.0, 5.0S mm in lengths of 9, 11, 13, 15mm.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Provision of informed consent
- Aged 18-70 years at enrolment
- A lingual-buccal difference in bone height between 2.0-5.0 mm at the implant site
- History of edentulism in the study area of at least 3 months
- Presence of alveolar bone crest dimensions judged by the investigator to allow >1mm of bone circumferential to the implant after implant placement.
- In need for a single implant replacing a missing tooth in any location with an adjacent natural tooth mesially, and an adjacent natural tooth or edentulous space distally to the planned implant position (i.e. no existing or planned implant adjacent to the planned study implant position)
- Deemed by the investigator as likely to present an initially stable implant situation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled pathological processes in the oral cavity
- Known or suspected current malignancy
- History of radiation therapy in the head and neck region
- History of chemotherapy within 5 years prior to surgery
- Systemic or local disease or condition that would compromise post-operative healing and/or osseointegration
- Uncontrolled diabetes mellitus
- Corticosteroids or any other medication that would compromise post-operative healing and/or osseointegration
- Smoking more than 10 cigarettes per day
- Present alcohol and/or drug abuse
- Current need for bone grafting in the planned implant area
- Previous enrolment in the present study
- Simultaneous participation in another clinical study or participation in a clinical study during the last 6 months
- Involvement in the planning and conduct of the study (applies to both Astra Tech staff or staff at the study site)
- Unlikely to be able to comply with study procedures, as judged by the investigator

overall_official.affiliation: Department of Periodontology, Sahlgrenska Academy at University of Gothenburg

facility.name: Department of Periodontology, College of Dental Medicine, Nova Southeastern University
Department of Periodontics, Robert Schattner Center, School of Dental Medicine, University of Pennsylvania

results_reference.citation: Noelken R, Donati M, Fiorellini J, Gellrich NC, Parker W, Wada K, Berglundh T. Soft and hard tissue alterations around implants placed in an alveolar ridge with a sloped configuration. Clin Oral Implants Res. 2014 Jan;25(1):3-9. doi: 10.1111/clr.12079. Epub 2012 Dec 5.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
